articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by Art Squad of KPA Large Combined Unit
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by Art Squad of KPA Large Combined Unit

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, enjoyed a performance given by the art squad of KPA Large Combined Unit 324.
					
					Put on the stage were colorful numbers of diverse genres including female quintet "Glory to Our Great Party", male solo "Tell, the Road of Songun," guitar quintet "At a Breath," drama and chorus "They Are Looking at Us," mixed chorus "Our Army, Our People", female solo "Arirang on Jiansanfeng" and chorus "Song of Defending Country".
					
					The performers represented the invincible might of the powerful revolutionary army of Mt. Paektu which has grown to be a matchless army and the loyalty of the servicepersons of the People's Army serving it with yearning for the Supreme Commander.
					
					They also reflected the ideological and moral traits of the servicepersons of the large combined unit spending days and nights with combat preparations, following the enemies' provocative moves with vigilance. 
					
					He expressed great satisfaction over the splendid performance rich in ideological contents and high in artistry with numbers of great cognitional and educational value as they truthfully reflect the inexhaustible mental power and noble moral traits of the KPA dynamically advancing full of optimism and enthusiasm, equipped with transparent outlook on the leader and the revolution. He highly appreciated their successful performance.
					
					He repeatedly praised the performers for their successful presentation, saying he watched the performances of the art squad of the large combined units several times and the one given by it this time was the best. He extended a warm salute to creators and artistes.
					
					He noted the members of the art squad are high in artistic skills and the numbers staged by them are firm in their ideological stand and their contents are good as they are firmly based on the service of the soldiers.
					
					He expressed expectation and conviction that the members of the art squad of the large combined unit would conduct dynamic revolutionary and militant art agitation in the future, too.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Arrives in Dar-Es-Salaam
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Arrives in Dar-Es-Salaam

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, arrived in Dar-Es-Salaam on Thursday to pay an official goodwill visit to Tanzania.
					
					His suite members included Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun.
					
					They were greeted by Bernard Kamillius Membe, minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation, Celina Kombani, minister of Constitution and Justice, the commander of the Army, the superintendent-general of the Police and officials of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation, and Jo Yong Man, DPRK ambassador to Tanzania.
					
					A welcome ceremony took place at the airport.
					
					Kim Yong Nam reviewed the guard of honor of the Tanzanian army.
					
					Many artistes danced and cheered in welcome of Kim Yong Nam and his party.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the World Peace Federation led by President Moon Hyung Jin arrived here Friday.
					
					On the same day the delegation of the State Maritime Supervisory Bureau of the DPRK led by Vice-Director Jon Ki Chol came back home after attending the 27th Assembly of the International Maritime Organization in Britain.

articles.title: Economic Zone Law Enacted in DPRK
articles.content:
Economic Zone Law Enacted in DPRK

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The DPRK adopted law on the economic zone on Hwanggumphyong and Wihwa islets in the River Amnok, according to a decree issued by the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly some days ago.
					
					Meanwhile, the law on the Rason economic and trade zone was amended and supplemented.

articles.title: State Commendation Awarded to Ryongsong Machine Complex in DPRK
articles.content:
State Commendation Awarded to Ryongsong Machine Complex in DPRK

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The Ryongsong Machine Complex of the DPRK was awarded the title of Labor Hero and Gold Medal (Hammer and Sickle) and Order of National Flag First Class.
					
					By displaying the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance, the complex successfully produced up-to-date equipment, large-size equipment and installations, urgently needed in different domains of the national economy, with its own efforts and technology in a short span of time. 
					
					The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on Wednesday issued a decree on awarding the title to the complex.

articles.title: Merited Persons Honored in DPRK
articles.content:
Merited Persons Honored in DPRK

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- State commendations were given to officials, scientists, technicians and workers who performed feats in successfully ensuring the production, assembly and trial operation of oxygen separator with a capacity of 15 000 cubic meters in the DPRK.
					
					The title of DPRK Labor Hero, accompanied by Gold Medal (Hammer and Sickle) and Order of National Flag First Class, was conferred on five persons and Order of Kim Il Sung to one person. Such commendations as Kim Il Sung Prize, Kim Il Sung Youth Honor Prize, honorary titles, orders and medals were awarded to 1 410 of the Rakwon Machine Complex.
					
					Also commendations were conferred on those officials, scientists, technicians, workers and helpers who made distinguished service in the construction of the first-phase process for gasification at the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex. 
					
					3 818 persons won commendations. 24 of them received the title of Labor Hero and two Order of Kim Il Sung.
					
					Meanwhile official commendations were given to meritorious officials, technicians and employees of the Taehung Youth Hero Mine and the Taehung Noodle House. They drastically increased the production of magnesia clinker and light burned magnesia by putting the magnesia industry on a Juche-oriented basis, turned out new products and did devoted services for workers and inhabitants.
					
					Three persons of the Mine received the title of Labor Hero and 388 honorary titles, orders and medals.
					
					The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on Wednesday issued decrees on awarding those commendations.

articles.title: Prospecting Goes Well in Korea
articles.content:
Prospecting Goes Well in Korea

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Provincial prospecting bureaus of the DPRK have produced good results in this year's geological and hydrogeological surveys.
					
					The Namsagang and Huchang prospecting corps under the Ryanggang Provincial Prospecting Bureau finished a survey of valuable minerals in different areas of the province by mid-November.
					
					The South Hamgyong Provincial Prospecting Bureau carried out a boring prospecting in the eastern part of Mt. Komdok, finding out mineral deposits as large as hundreds of thousands of tonnes.
					
					Large coal deposits were discovered by the South Phyongan Provincial Prospecting Bureau.
					
					The North Hamgyong Provincial Hydrogeological Prospecting Bureau completed an initial prospecting in Samjiyon, Taehongdan, Paekam and Yonsa counties for the survey of the volcanic activity in Mt. Paektu.
					
					The Jagang, South Hamgyong and South Phyongan provincial prospecting bureaus have overfulfilled their boring plans for the construction of the Huichon Power Plant.
					
					The South Hwanghae Provincial Prospecting Bureau successfully carried out a foundation project for waterway construction.

articles.title: Machine-building Industry Makes Headway in DPRK
articles.content:
Machine-building Industry Makes Headway in DPRK

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Modern machine factories in Jagang Province, the DPRK, are taking the lead in the drive of developing the machine-building industry. 
					
					The Huichon Ryonha General Machine Plant manufactures CNC (computer numerical control) machine tools like 3, 4 and 5-axis ones.
					
					The large-sized plant has sharply raised the rate of localization in producing parts in a matter of less than one year, remarkably increasing the competitiveness of its products in foreign markets.
					
					The machine factories in the province established an integrated control system and put their production and management on a scientific and technological basis. 
					
					Following them, Kusong-based machine producer is turning out a variety of CNC machine tools, while other machine factories in the country are working on putting the production and management on a computer basis.
					
					Meanwhile, a modern tool factory was built in the country to produce various kinds of quality tools.

articles.title: Servicepersons' Art Performance Draws Many People in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Servicepersons' Art Performance Draws Many People in Pyongyang

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Company soldiers have continued giving an art performance at the People's Palace of Culture in Pyongyang.
					
					The numbers include narration and chorus "Let Us Sing of Fatherly Love," chorus "Magpie Clattering at Post" and serial songs "The Distinguished Service Medal of Solider."
					
					The performance won acclaim from the audience for its vivid representation of the servicepersons remaining faithful to their Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il and reliably defending the country. 
					
					After appreciating it, citizens described it as an example of mass-based culture and arts in the Songun (military-first) era. They also said such a great performance can be given only by those who prepared themselves politically, ideologically and culturally and in military technique.

articles.title: Literature of Palhae Kingdom
articles.content:
Literature of Palhae Kingdom

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Palhae Kingdom, which lasted for some 200 years from the year 698 after the demise of the Koguryo Kingdom, boasted of its developed literature.
					
					It put the Korean nation's literature in the middle ages on a high level.  Its literary works, characterized by vivid descriptive, lyric and narrative art, give a glimpse of the patriotic-minded spirit of the Palhae people.
					
					Typical of them are poems composed by Yang Thae Sa and Wang Hyo Ryom.
					
					In particular, a man, named Paejong, was widely known in Palhae and other countries as a gifted poet.
					
					The literature of Palhae remains one of the Korean nation's precious cultural heritages.

articles.title: Kamsin Tomb, One of Korean Nation's Cultural Heritages
articles.content:
Kamsin Tomb, One of Korean Nation's Cultural Heritages

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The Kamsin tomb in Nampho City, Korea, is a mural tomb dating back to Koguryo Kingdom (B.C. 277-A.D. 668)
					
					The half-underground tomb consists of a corridor and chambers.
					
					Figure and genre paintings were drawn on the plastered walls of the chambers.
					
					The paintings portray a musical band, wagons, servants and servicepersons to present the dignified appearance of the deceased.
					
					They showcase musical instruments, weapons, architecture, lifestyle and customs and military uniforms in the period of Koguryo Kingdom.
					
					The tomb, preserved as one of the Korean nation's cultural heritages, is indicative of the developed culture of Koguryo in the early 4th century.

articles.title: Korean-style Socialism Is Biggest Gain in 100-year History of Kim Il Sung's Korea -- Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Korean-style Socialism Is Biggest Gain in 100-year History of Kim Il Sung's Korea--Rodong Sinmun

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses is the great choice and sum in the history of 100 years under the Juche calendar, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in a bylined article.
					
					The history of Korean-style socialism is just the sacred history of President Kim Il Sung's revolutionary activities, the article says, and goes on:
					
					He devoted his whole life to building socialism of Juche, and so it is impossible to talk about Juche socialism without the august name of the President. 
					
					The centenary history of Kim Il Sung's Korea is the glorious history in which the problem of consolidating and developing the ideological foundation of socialism has been successfully solved under the banner of Juche.
					
					The struggle for socialism in the DPRK has been waged under the most correct guideline since its start thanks to the extraordinary insight and foresightedness of Kim Il Sung.
					
					The Juche-based theory on socialism is displaying its vitality through centuries with the energetic activities of leader Kim Jong Il, the peerless thinker-theoretician.
					
					The centenary of Kim Il Sung's Korea is a history in which genuine socialism was built in this land and its true nature has been preserved steadfastly.
					
					The history of socialist movement in the present times clearly proves the immovable truth that socialism will go to ruin if its true nature is abandoned, but will win, if preserved. 
					
					A boundlessly rosy future is in store for Korean-style socialism that will greet the second century of Juche, the article says, and continues:
					
					It is the irresistible trend of the world at present to aspire after socialism. As long as there are people and the struggle of mankind for social progress continues, socialism will exist forever.
					
					As everyone officially recognizes, Korean-style socialism is the most reasonable socialist system which is able to solve the serious social problems in the present times.
					
					The most admirable success in the centenary history of Juche is that the problem of ensuring continuity of the socialist cause was settled perfectly in keeping with the demand of the revolution and the aspiration of the people.
					
					There is no doubt that Korean socialism, with greatest superiority and might over capitalism, will make a history of victory and miracle in its new centenary, too.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Foiling Imperialists' Reactionary Offensive
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Foiling Imperialists' Reactionary Offensive

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- It is urgent to foil the reactionary offensive of the imperialists with the revolutionary one in the light of the desire of the popular masses for independence and the requirement of the prevailing situation of the revolution, says Rodong Sinmun in a bylined article Friday. 
					
					The imperialists' reactionary offensive has been typified by the military threats and blackmail, economic disturbances, creation of illusion about capitalism and bourgeois ideological and cultural poisoning, the article says, adding:
					
					Those countries which took steps back, failing to stand against the imperialists' reactionary offensive are suffering from bitter political chaos, serious social contradiction, disputes and disturbances. The imperialists try to make those countries their colonies. 
					
					The present international situation shows that the failure to foil the imperialists' reactionary offensive will entail tragic results.
					
					The world progressive people should see through the weakness of imperialists and frustrate their reactionary offensive with the revolutionary one. 
					
					It is impossible for those weak in military strength to win in their just stand-off with the imperialists keen on aggression, war, domination and interference. Only strong self-defensive capabilities can help fight off any military attack by the imperialists. 
					
					The anti-imperialist independent forces can certainly foil the reactionary offensive if they rise up in unity. 
					
					Victory always stands by justice and truth.

articles.title: S. Korea's Saber-rattling against Peace Slammed: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
S. Korea's Saber-rattling against Peace Slammed: Rodong Sinmun

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The south Korean warmongers kicked off a large-scale saber-rattling, while trumpeting about "punishment", instead of looking back upon their crime of having preempted a fire into the inviolable territorial waters of the DPRK one year ago and practicing self-restraint. This is a reckless act that can be committed by those who are bereft of reason. 
					
					Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a bylined article.
					
					The moves to provoke a war against the DPRK are a treacherous act openly denying the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, the paper says, adding:
					
					It is beyond doubt that if these declarations are successfully implemented, the Korean people's desire for the peaceful reunification of the country will come true.
					
					The south Korean authorities, however, have escalated the confrontation with the DPRK in collusion with outside forces and stooped to any infamy to ignite a war against it under the absurd pretexts of forcing it to "scrap its nukes first" and leading it to "opening". Their criminal acts, a blatant challenge to the inter-Korean declarations, clearly show the sinister intention of the warmongers who are least interested in the peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					What the present ruling forces of south Korea are seeking is the "unification under the system of liberal democracy" presupposing doing harm to the compatriots' idea and system with armed forces, not an independent and peaceful reunification unanimously desired by the Koreans.
					
					The DPRK wants the improved north-south relations and peace of the country, but it will never show mercy to the traitors who are intent on the moves to provoke a war in collusion with outside forces, clean indifferent to the nation's reconciliation, unity and reunification.
					
					Their moves will invite nothing but a miserable end.

articles.title: S. Korea's Anti-DPRK Human Rights Campaign Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korea's Anti-DPRK Human Rights Campaign Slammed

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea issued on Friday information bulletin No. 988 as regards the south Korean authorities' smear human rights campaign against the DPRK. 
					
					It said:
					
					The puppet group has recently cried out for "earlier enactment of north's human rights act" while issuing "white paper on human rights" and holding "exhibitions" and "film festivals". It instigated the ultra-right conservative group and defectors to the south to tour the whole of south Korea and foreign countries, to kick up an anti-DPRK human rights campaign.
					
					Some time ago, the group took the lead in working out a "resolution on north's human rights" at the UN General Assembly. It even brought the issue of "sending family members" of human scum to the south up for discussion on the international arena. 
					
					It is ridiculous and shameless for the south Korean puppet group dare to find fault with the dignity and system of the DPRK and launch a human rights ruckus against it. 
					
					The group's persistent moves are prompted by black-hearted intentions to assuage the public discontent with its total domestic and foreign policy failure, economic bankruptcy, people's destitution and corruption as well as divert elsewhere people's criticism of it and justify its confrontational moves against fellow countrymen. 
					
					The group patronized human scum who fled the DPRK after deserting his family for his own sake and egged him on to take part in the anti-DPRK smear campaign. It only shows the miserable plight of the group.
					
					Finding it unable to attain its sinister intentions with war and confrontation policy, the group hatched a plot to defile the international prestige by taking the advantage of the U.S.-led imperialists' human rights offensive. This is, however, as absurd as trying to get the sun eclipsed by palms. 
					
					These moves will bring it nothing but bitterer wrath and denunciation from all Koreans and worsen north-south relations. 
					
					The people of the DPRK will never tolerate those who slander its dignity and system. 
					
					The south Korean group had better mind its own business and worry about its destiny at the deathbed, instead of taking issue with others' human rights.

articles.title: GNP's Cyber Terrorism Accused in S. Korea
articles.content:
GNP's Cyber Terrorism Accused in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea made public a statement on Dec. 6 in denunciation of the cyber attacks by the "Grand National Party."
					
					It has been disclosed that the GNP group perpetrated Ddos attacks on internet websites of the Central Election Commission and independent candidate, who ran for Seoul mayoral race, during the October 26 election, the statement noted, saying:
					
					This is a serious crime reminiscent of the March 15 fraudulent election staged by the Syngman Rhee dictatorial forces.
					
					The GNP deceives the people, negating the cyber attacks despite the facts proving this crime which have been disclosed one after another.
					
					The Intelligence Service, too, can never evade the blame for such attacks because it feigned ignorance of them for several hours though it might have prevented them at the beginning.
					
					The statement demanded that the GNP be disbanded at once and the chief executive step down of his own accord with responsibility for making mockery of population.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Important Days of DPRK Observed Abroad

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries between Nov. 30 and Dec. 5 to mark the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero. They included meetings in Romania and Benin and opening ceremony of Korean book and handicraft exhibition and photo exhibition in Russia.
					
					Displayed in their venues were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, photos on their immortal exploits and books, photos and handicrafts showing the might of Songun Korea.
					
					The chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania said that the might of the KPA has remarkably strengthened and the DPRK has turned into a country of Songun with powerful military muscle under the guidance of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il.
					
					The chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" noted that Kim Jong Il has reliably carried forward the President's idea and exploits in army building.
					
					The secretary general of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and General Kim Jong Il's Works said: In her lifetime Kim Jong Suk used to request his son to be excellent general in the future like the President. Her request and desire have become a brilliant reality with the picture of the DPRK advancing toward prosperity under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					The mayor of Khabarovsk City of Russia wished the Korean people great success in socialist construction under wise guidance of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported by Various Parties
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported by Various Parties

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Delegates of different countries to the forum on the tasks of political parties to cope with the crisis of capitalism held in Brazil made public a joint statement "We fully support the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the Korean people in the efforts to build a prosperous and powerful socialist country" on Dec. 1.
					
					They were delegates of the Brazilian Communist Party, the Socialist Party of Argentina, the Socialist Party of Chile, the Socialist Party of Uruguay, the Socialist Party of Ecuador, the Socialist Party of Peru, the Progressive Movement of Colombia and the Lebanese Communist Party. 
					
					The statement said:
					
					Now in the DPRK a gigantic work is going on to realize the lifelong desire of President Kim Il Sung and fresh miracles and innovations are being wrought day after day.
					
					We are sure that under the Songun revolutionary leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, the WPK and the Korean people will achieve signal successes in the work to commemorate the centenary of birth of the President as the most auspicious holiday common to the world's progressive mankind.
					
					We extend full support to the WPK and the Korean people in their efforts to open the gate to prosperity.
					
					We call upon the progressive parities and organizations of the world to extend support and solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle to defend socialism and realize the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: Russia Dismisses U.S. Criticism over Election as Unacceptable
articles.content:
Russia Dismisses U.S. Criticism over Election as Unacceptable

					Moscow, December 8 (KCNA) -- Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov accused U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton of having suggested that the Sunday's parliamentary elections in Russia were neither free nor fair. 
					
					Lavrov dismissed Clinton's remark as an expression of interference in internal affairs and double standard.
					
					If one of the two sides has something to demand to other side, he should make it clear through dialogue, he said. 
					
					The chairman of the Central Election Commission of Russia advised Clinton to have concerns about the presidential election to be held in U.S. in 2012.

articles.title: Russia to Take Counteraction against MD in Europe
articles.content:
Russia to Take Counteraction against MD in Europe

					Moscow, December 8 (KCNA) -- Nikolai Makarov, chief of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, in a diplomatic meeting Wednesday expressed the stand of his country to take strong counteraction against the missile defense system in Europe. 
					
					Russia put forward various proposals over this issue but the United States and the West refused them, he said, adding they repeatedly talked nonsense without any proposal that the MD would not threaten Russia's strategic nuclear armed forces.
					
					Russia does not want armament race, but the U.S. and the West push Russia into such race, he said.

articles.title: Russia to Take Step for Protecting Children
articles.content:
Russia to Take Step for Protecting Children

					Moscow, December 8 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev recently ratified the law on protecting the rights of children.
					
					According to it, the law on basic guarantee for the rights of children was revised and some new regulations are to be introduced.

articles.title: Putin Describes Election Results As Most Appropriate
articles.content:
Putin Describes Election Results As Most Appropriate

					Moscow, December 8 (KCNA) -- The Russian prime minister termed the results of the State Duma election the most appropriate ones reflecting the current situation of Russia.
					
					Speaking at a recent meeting with senior officials of the United Russia Party, Vladimir Putin voiced the belief that the nation's stable development would be achieved on the basis of the success attained by the party in the election.

articles.title: Chinese Official Calls for Widely Introducing Legal System
articles.content:
Chinese Official Calls for Widely Introducing Legal System

					Beijing, December 8 (KCNA) -- Chen Changzhi, vice-chairman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress, called for developing the education in law observance.
					
					Addressing a round-table talk held in Beijing recently, the vice-chairman said that the education is an important and basic issue for governing the country by law. 
					
					The official also underscored the need to introduce the socialist legal system with Chinese characteristics in a profound way to improve public understanding and view of the law.

articles.title: 1 180 ha of Woodland Created in Beijing
articles.content:
1 180 ha of Woodland Created in Beijing

					Beijing, December 8 (KCNA) -- Beijing, China has put successful effort to forestation.
					
					The city has so far created 1 180 ha of woodland this year.

articles.title: Strengthening of Social Management Urged in China
articles.content:
Strengthening of Social Management Urged in China

					Beijing, December 8 (KCNA) -- Recently, the Supreme People's Procuratorate of China announced a ten-point measure for strengthening the social management.  
					
					The measure called on organs of prosecution to direct efforts to preventing crimes and solving the basic and essential problems existing in the social management field.

articles.title: China Issues Foreign Trade White Paper
articles.content:
China Issues Foreign Trade White Paper

					Beijing, December 8 (KCNA) -- The Information Office of Chinese State Council released a white paper "Foreign Trade of China" on Wednesday. 
					
					The white paper introduced China's economic and trade cooperation with other countries on the basis of equality and reciprocity.    
					
					China's foreign trade development will keep the country closely linked with world, propel its modernization process and promote the prosperity and development of the world.

articles.title: Belarusian President Opposes U.S. Deployment of MD in Europe
articles.content:
Belarusian President Opposes U.S. Deployment of MD in Europe

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Belarusian President Aleksandr Lukashenko in a recent press conference clarified the stand opposing the U.S. deployment of the missile defense system in Europe.
					
					Deploying MD in the area along Russia's border means deploying it in the area along that of Belarus, he said, voicing his country's sympathy with Russia's concern over the U.S. MD in Europe.

articles.title: Mexico Calls for Strengthened Cooperation with Regional Countries
articles.content:
Mexico Calls for Strengthened Cooperation with Regional Countries

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Mexican President Felipe Calderon Hinojosa, addressing a meeting of a regional organization on Monday, called for strengthening cooperation with the regional countries.
					
					Calderon called on countries in Central America to make greater efforts to beef up regional security on the basis of the achievements made in combating drug trafficking, arms trafficking, money laundering and human trafficking.
					
					He expressed the stand of his government to contribute to achieving prosperity and security in Central America together with the regional countries.

articles.title: Iran No Threat to Gulf: UAE VP
articles.content:
Iran No Threat to Gulf: UAE VP

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- United Arab Emirates' Vice President and Prime Minister Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum resolutely rejected the West's fiction of Iran's threat in the CNN interview Tuesday.
					
					While Western powers have increased their pressure on Iran because of Tehran's nuclear energy project, the UAE leader said: "I don't believe that Iran will develop a nuclear weapon."
					
					There is no reason why Iran makes nuclear weapons, he said, stressing that his country does not regard the Islamic republic as a threat, neither to the Gulf region nor to anybody else.

articles.title: PNA Urges Israel to Stop Settlements Building
articles.content:
PNA Urges Israel to Stop Settlements Building

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- There would be no peace negotiations with Israel without a settlement freeze, chief Palestinian negotiator Saeb Erekat said Tuesday.
					
					When meeting with U.S. Assistant Secretary of State for Near Eastern Affairs Jeffrey Feltman, Erekat said:
					
					"The Palestinian bid to get a full membership at the United Nations would continue," said Erekat, quoted by a statement issued by his office.
					
					The Palestinian official also asked the United States to stop considering Israel a state which is above the law.

articles.title: Nasrallah: We Would Safeguard Resistance with Our Blood
articles.content:
Nasrallah: We Would Safeguard Resistance with Our Blood

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Hezbollah Secretary General Seyyed Hassan Nasrallah at a ceremony Monday called for continuing resistance.
					
					"We will not depart from our sacred land so that the occupiers would capture it", he noted.
					
					The objective of resistance is defending the people, the country, and the only thing we want in return is that the enemies would leave us alone and stop interfering in our work, he said.
					
					If the people would be united the country and the nation would gain strength, he said, calling upon all Lebanese to turn out in the resistance in unity.

articles.title: Cambodia Launches Social Protection Strategy for Poor
articles.content:
Cambodia Launches Social Protection Strategy for Poor

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Cambodia on Monday officially launched the National Social Protection Strategy for the Poor and Vulnerable, aimed at protecting the poorest and most disadvantaged against chronic poverty and hunger, shocks, and destitution.
					
					It is said that the national poverty rate had dropped from 34.7 percent in 2004 to 30.1 percent in 2007 and to 25.8 percent last year.

articles.title: China Boosts Cooperation with Different Countries
articles.content:
China Boosts Cooperation with Different Countries

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- China and Ukraine on Dec. 6 agreed to boost cooperation on security issues.
					
					China signed an agreement with Niger on Dec. 5 on cooperation in the educational field. It also agreed with Bolivia to boost bilateral cooperation in the military field.
					
					That day China and Laos agreed to strengthen bilateral friendship and solidarity and develop military exchanges and cooperation, in particular

articles.title: Palestinian Official Condemns Israeli Threats to Freeze Tax Revenues
articles.content:
Palestinian Official Condemns Israeli Threats to Freeze Tax Revenues

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Hanan Ashrawi, a member of Palestine Liberation Organization's Executive Committee, on Tuesday condemned Israeli threats to freeze tax revenues again if Palestinians continued efforts to obtain membership in United Nations agencies.
					
					"The continued withholding of the money is a theft and it aims to get political concessions," Ashrawi said, adding that the Palestinian leadership will not stop bidding for the UN membership.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Indonesia
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Indonesia

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 6.1 on the Richter scale hit Papua Province of Indonesia on Tuesday.

articles.title: Young Greeks Want to Leave Debt-laden Greece: Survey
articles.content:
Young Greeks Want to Leave Debt-laden Greece: Survey

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Voices of pessimism and concern over the future of the country are being loudly heard among young Greeks.
					
					Six out of 10 young Greeks want to leave their country because of the severe debt crisis, according to a new survey published on Monday.

articles.title: OECD Report Shows Members Facing Greater Inequality Challenges
articles.content:
OECD Report Shows Members Facing Greater Inequality Challenges

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- A report released on Monday by the Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) showed that its member countries are facing greater inequality risks.
					
					According to the report, the gap between rich and poor in OECD countries has reached its highest level for over 30 years.
					
					The report found out that the average income of the richest 10 percent of the population is now about nine times that of the poorest 10 percent across the OECD.

articles.title: Australia's Current Account Deficit
articles.content:
Australia's Current Account Deficit

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS) reported on Tuesday said current account deficit was 5.64 billion AU dollars (5.78 billion U.S. dollars) in the September quarter.

articles.title: Accidents in U.S. and Japan
articles.content:
Accidents in U.S. and Japan

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- A raging fire destroyed a gas station convenience store near Alaska's Denali National Park Sunday night and injured several people, authorities said.
					
					Eight Ferraris, three Mercedes-Benz cars and a Lamborghini crashed in a massive 14-vehicle accident in southwestern Japan.
					
					Ten drivers were hospitalized, but no one was seriously injured, police said.

articles.title: Intensified Anti-Wall Street Demo in U.S.
articles.content:
Intensified Anti-Wall Street Demo in U.S.

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The struggle against exploitation and oppression by capital is gaining in scope in the United States. 
					
					A fierce anti-Wall Street protest took place in Capital Hill on Tuesday. Protesters brought their message about alleged U.S. economic unfairness to Capital Hill, sitting in or outside several Senate and House offices.
					
					The police cracked down on the protesters, taking away some of them.
					
					Meanwhile, scores of police officers marched into an encampment of protesters of Occupy New Orleans movement across from City Hall before dawn Tuesday, forcing the dozens of occupants out and removing tents. 
					
					"You are treasonous!" one protester shouted as more than 100 uniformed officers moved through the makeshift camp grounds.

articles.title: Murder Cases Unabated in U.S.
articles.content:
Murder Cases Unabated in U.S.

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Shocking kidnapping and murder cases occurred in the United States, a country plagued with whole gamut of crimes.
					
					The body of a 7-year old girl was found in the garbage ground of an apartment building in Atlantic City, New Jersey State a few days ago.
					
					She was last seen playing around her home before going missing.
					
					Traces proving that she was sexually assaulted and wounds caused by stab were found on her head and several other parts of her body.
					
					Earlier, an 8-year old girl was also found dead after she was kidnapped in July.
					
					Foreign media reported that the U.S. society has been shocked by the horrifying deaths of sexually abused little girls.

articles.title: Latin American and Caribbean Countries Unite Independent of U.S.
articles.content:
Latin American and Caribbean Countries Unite Independent of U.S.

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Countries in the Latin American and Caribbean region have bolstered their efforts to defend sovereignty and independence free from the U.S. political domination.
					
					The Third Summit of Latin America and the Caribbean took place in Caracas, Venezuela between Dec. 2 and 3.
					
					At the summit the founding of a new political bloc, the Community of Latin American and Caribbean States (CELAC) made up of 33 American countries except U.S. and Canada, was officially proclaimed.
					
					The founding of CELAC is a result of the concerted efforts made by the regional countries to end the U.S. political domination, make independent development and boost regional influence in the international arena.
					
					The Latin American countries stepped up the regional integration and, at the same time, pushed forward the founding of the regional community with an objective to terminate the U.S. domination.
					
					The First Summit of Latin America and the Caribbean on the regional integration and development was convened in December, 2008 with the attendance of 33 countries except U.S. and Canada. At the meeting they agreed to organize CELAC. A resolution on founding CELAC was adopted at the Second Summit in Mexico in February, 2010.
					
					This led to the official organization of CELAC.
					
					Heads of state including Venezuela, Cuba, Mexico, Chile, Brazil and Colombia described the foundation of CELAC as a landmark event for independence in the present era and the regional development, voicing their will to strengthen it into a political bloc that exercises big influence in the international arena.

articles.title: Global Carbon Emissions Reach 10 Bln Tonnes: Report
articles.content:
Global Carbon Emissions Reach 10 Bln Tonnes: Report

					Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The total carbon emissions in the world reached 10 billion tonnes for the first time, said an international report on Monday.
					
					Carbon dioxide emissions caused by fossil fuel burning last year increased by 49 percent compared with that of 20 years ago, said the report.

articles.title: Premier coreano recorre Complejo Siderurgico de Hwanghae
articles.content:
Premier coreano recorre Complejo Siderurgico de Hwanghae

					Pyongyang, 9 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim estudio la vispera la labor del Complejo Siderurgico de Hwanghae.
					
					Al cabo de dar vueltas por los lugares de construccion del horno de sintetizar, el taller de separador de oxigeno de gran dimension, el horno de generador de gas, la lingotera continua, etc., el premier convoco una reunion consultiva.
					
					En la ocasion, fueron discutidos los problemas de culminar cuanto antes los procesos de produccion en construccion y producir a tiempo los rieles pesados inminentemente necesarios a varios dominios de la economia nacional y tomadas las detalladas medidas para hacer que las unidades relacionadas suministren suficientemente las materias primas y materiales.

articles.title: Arriba a Dar-Es-Salaam Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Arriba a Dar-Es-Salaam Kim Yong Nam

					Pyongyang, 9 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, llego el dia 8 a Dar-Es-Salaam para realizar una visita oficial y de amistad a la Republica Unida de Tanzania.
					
					Llegaron tambien el canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun y otros acompanantes.
					
					Les acogieron el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores y Cooperacion Internacional, Bernard Kamillius Membe, el ministro de Constitucion y Justicia, Celina Kombani, el comandante del ejercito, las personalidades del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores y Cooperacion Internacional y el embajador coreano acreditado en ese pais africano Jo Yong Man.
					
					En el aeropuerto tuvo lugar la ceremonia de bienvenida a Kim Yong Nam.
					
					Kim paso revista a la guardia de honor del ejercito tanzanio.
					
					Muchos artistas dieron bienvenida a Kim Yong Nam y su comitiva danzando y aclamando.

articles.title: En Pyongyang delegacion de Federacion Mundial de la Paz
articles.content:
En Pyongyang delegacion de Federacion Mundial de la Paz

					Pyongyang, 9 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Llego el dia 9 a esta capital la delegacion de la Federacion Mundial de la Paz encabezada por el presidente Mun Hyong Jin.

articles.title: Rusia censura a Hillary Clinton
articles.content:
Rusia censura a Hillary Clinton

					Moscu, 8 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El canciller ruso Serguei Lavrov condeno el dia 7 a la secretaria de Estado de Estados Unidos, Hillary Clinton, que dijo que las elecciones de la Duma Estatal efectuadas recientemente en Rusia fueron "no libres e injustas", calificandolo de la intervencion en los asuntos internos del Estado soberano y de la expresion de doble rasero.
					
					Subrayo que si ambas partes tienen algo que demandar a la contraparte, deben aclararlo mediante el dialogo.
					
					Por otra parte, el presidente del comite central de las elecciones de Rusia reprocho que la secretaria de Estado estadounidense se preocupe por las elecciones presidenciales que tendran lugar en el proximo ano.
